intro: Buraeavia horneana, commonly known as the Hornéan's burr vine, is a climbing plant native to parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
